description: [Status: stable] [Name: zip-dict-keys-and-values] [Message: Use {expected} instead of {actual}] What it does Checks for use of zip() to iterate over keys and values of a dictionary at once. Why is this bad? The dict type provides an .items() method which is faster and more readable. Example flag_stars = {"USA": 50, "Slovenia": 3, "Panama": 2, "Australia": 6} for country, stars in zip(flag_stars.keys(), flag_stars.values()): print(f"{country}'s flag has {stars} stars.") Use instead: flag_stars = {"USA": 50, "Slovenia": 3, "Panama": 2, "Australia": 6} for country, stars in flag_stars.items(): print(f"{country}'s flag has {stars} stars.") Fix safety This rule's fix is marked as safe, unless the expression contains comments.
